009
010package imagingbook.common.threshold.global;
011
012import imagingbook.common.histogram.HistogramUtils;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * This is an implementation of the global "quantile" thresholder, described in
017 * Sec. 9.1 (Alg. 9.1) of [1].
018 * Requires the quantile (b) to be specified at instantiation.
019 * Method {@link #getThreshold(int[])} returns a threshold that will put AT LEAST the
020 * b-fraction of pixels (but not all pixels) in the background.
021 * </p>
022 * <p>
023 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>,
024 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
025 * </p>
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2022/08/22
029 */
030public class QuantileThresholder implements GlobalThresholder {
031        
032        private final double b; // quantile of expected background pixels
033        
034        public QuantileThresholder(double b) {
035                if (b <= 0 || b >= 1) {
036                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("quantile b must be in [0,1]");
037                }
038                this.b = b;
039        }
040
041        @Override
042        public int getThreshold(int[] h) {
043                int K = h.length;
044                int N = HistogramUtils.count(h);        // total number of pixels       
045                double n = N * b;               // number of pixels in quantile
046                
047                int i = 0;
048                int c = h[0];
049                while (i < K && c < n) {
050                        i++;
051                        c = c + h[i];
052                }
053                
054                int q = (c < N) ? i : -1; // check if all pixels are included by the estimated threshold
055                return q;
056        }
057}
